definitions.definition: keep safe or rescue (someone or something) from harm or danger.
examples: she saved a boy from drowning
synonyms: extricate; bail out; informalsave someone's bacon/neck/skin "the captain was saved by his crew"preserve
rescue "the farmhouse has been saved from demolition"

examples: the doctors did everything they could to save him

definitions.definition: (in Christian use) preserve (a person's soul) from damnation.
keep (someone) in health (used in exclamations and formulaic expressions).
keep and store up (something, especially money) for future use.
examples: she had never been able to save much from her salary
synonyms: save for a rainy day; Moreinformalsalt away

definitions.definition: keep (data) by moving a copy to a storage location, especially from memory.
examples: save it to a new file

definitions.definition: preserve (something) by not expending or using it.
used to tell someone to stop talking.
examples: save it, Joey—I'm in big trouble now

definitions.definition: avoid the need to use up or spend (money, time, or other resources).

examples: this approach saves wear and tear on the books
synonyms: avert "asking me first would have saved a lot of trouble"

definitions.definition: prevent an opponent from scoring (a goal or point) in a game or from winning (the game).
examples: the powerful German saved three match points

definitions.definition: (of a relief pitcher in certain game situations) finish (a game) while preserving a winning position gained by another pitcher.
(of a goalkeeper) stop (a shot) from entering the goal.
